intro: Chondrilla acanthifolia, commonly known as the spiny goatweed, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and woolly, spiny foliage. The plant has small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are typically covered in fine hairs. Chondrilla acanthifolia is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access underground water. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural areas.
